message.content:
The regular expression (regex) that matches the desired three character code is as follows:
```
[a-zA-Z0-9]{3}\.usfm$
```

Explanation of regex components:

1. `[a-zA-Z0-9]`: This part of the regex matches any upper or lower case letter or digit.
2. `{3}`: This quantifier specifies that the preceding character class should match exactly three times.
3. `\.usfm$`: This part of the regex ensures that the matched string is followed by ".usfm" at the end of the filename (denoted by `$`).

To extract the desired code from a given filename using this regex in Python, you can use the `re` module as follows:

```python
import re

filename = "57-1Jn.usfm"
regex_pattern = r'[a-zA-Z0-9]{3}\.usfm$'
match = re.search(regex_pattern, filename)
if match:
    code = match.group()
    print("Extracted three character code:", code[:3])
else:
    print("No match found.")
```

This will output the extracted three character code: `1Jn`.
